title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Munetaka Murakami, a top hitter in Nippon Professional Baseball, has been posted for MLB free agency by the Tokyo Yakult Swallows.
Murakami, known as the "Japanese Babe Ruth," broke the NPB single-season home run record with 56 homers in 2022.
The Red Sox are seen as potential suitors for Murakami, especially with possible changes in their infield lineup.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Airlines waive fees due to a 10% flight reduction at 40 airports including Logan, caused by a government shutdown.
JetBlue and Southwest offer automatic rebooking and refunds for flights scheduled between Nov. 6-12, if affected.
United and Delta provide full refunds or fare-waived rescheduling; changes apply if the original ticket is booked by Nov. 5.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A Cape Cod crash has reignited calls for stricter e-bike regulations in Massachusetts due to rising safety concerns.
Lynne Forester, injured on a Cape Cod trail, advocates tougher e-bike rules, supported by 78% of 580 reader responses.
Current Massachusetts e-bike regulations classify them as bicycles, with no license required, but some suggest treating them like motor vehicles.

title: Watch: Dog rescued from Ted Williams Tunnel
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts State Police rescued a dog in the Ted Williams Tunnel after it evaded initial capture attempts.
The dog was spotted near East Boston, prompting police to halt traffic for a safe rescue.
MassDOT surveillance captured the dog hopping into a police cruiser, ensuring its safe retrieval.

title: Canterbury Farm, ‘a treasure to the Berkshires,’ closes after 40 years
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Canterbury Farm in Becket, Massachusetts, closed after 40 years, as owners Linda and Dave Bacon retire.
The Bacons managed a bed & breakfast and nordic center offering skiing, lodging, and various outdoor activities.
Challenges included changing weather conditions and increased competition from 150 local Airbnb establishments.

title: Patriots will be without three key players for matchup vs. Buccaneers
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Patriots' Rhamondre Stevenson, Kayshon Boutte, and Christian Elliss ruled out for Buccaneers game due to injuries.
TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings will lead the Patriots' backfield in Stevenson's absence again.
With Boutte out, Stefon Diggs, DeMario Douglas, and Mack Hollins remain primary targets for quarterback Drake Maye.

title: Is Drake Maye the MVP? Execs don’t think so, but several analysts do.
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye has led the Patriots to a 7-2 record and ranks among top NFL quarterbacks statistically this season.
NFL executives gave Maye one MVP vote in a poll, with Rams' Matthew Stafford leading; media opinions differ.
Analysts highlight Maye's elite performance despite limited support, but his light schedule and sack rate are criticized.

title: Who makes the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader recommendations for the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston.
Readers can submit their favorite spots by filling out a form or emailing the publication.
User contributions may be featured in a future guide to the best espresso martinis in the city.

title: Travelers face delays, cancellations at Logan Airport after FAA names it among airports impacted by the shutdown
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport experiences 107 delays and 38 cancellations due to a 10% reduction in air traffic during the government shutdown.
FAA includes Logan Airport among 40 'high-volume' markets with reduced air traffic starting Friday morning.
Massport advises travelers to check with airlines for updates and anticipates delays and cancellations in upcoming days.

title: 10 noteworthy stats after a month of hockey for 2025-26 Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins are on a winning streak, clinching six victories in their last seven games under coach Marco Sturm.
Hampus Lindholm's presence boosts Bruins' defense, with the penalty kill excelling at 96.6% when he plays.
Morgan Geekie and David Pastrnak's scoring has declined, producing 1.87 goals per 60 minutes of 5-on-5 play.
